src:
Radulović za Fajnenšal Tajms: Postoji sumnja da je Beograd na vodi projekat pranja novca

06 Nov 2019, 13:35

Predsednik pokreta Dosta je bilo (DJB) Saša Radulović izjavio je za Fajnenšel tajms da "postoji osnovana sumnja, koju bi morao da proveri tužilac ako bi radio svoj posao, da je u projektu Beograd na vodi na delu pranje novca", saopšila je danas press služba pokreta Dosta je bilo.Radulović je rekao da postoji sumnja da je "reč o novcu koji se iz Srbije izvlači kroz različite pronevere javnih sredstava i fondova, da bi se potom oprao i vratio u Srbiju kroz investicione fondove Ujedinjenih Arapskih Emirata koji, u stvari, samo uzimaju svoj procenat za pranje novca. Kada novac dodje ponovo u Srbiju, onda ljudi preko kojih je izašao iz zemlje, a reč je o ljudima iz vlasti, koriste taj novac za kupovinu imovine."Reč je o zemljištu na kome se gradi Beograd na vodi, ali i o poljoprivrednom zemljištu na raznim mestima u Vojvodini, o kompanijama i slično. Smatram da je to podloga svih ovih takozvanih "investicija u Srbiji". Ključno je to što su sve kompanije koje grade Beograd na vodi, kao i svi ljudi koji donose odluke, povezani sa ljudima iz vrha vlasti. Nema Arapa. Ne poznajem nikog ko bi se odlučio na ogromnu investiciju, a potom se za nju ne bi zanimao, već bi prepustio lokalnim ljudima da odlučuju ko dobija koliko novca", rekao je Radulović za Fajnenšel Tajms.Radulović je rekao i "da smo mi samo napravili plan razvoja tog zemljišta, a potom ga podelili na manje delove, mogli smo zaraditi i više od jedne milijarde evra. Dakle, sav taj novac je nestao kroz ovaj dil", navodi se u saopštenju DJB koje prenosi intervju za Fajnenšal Tajms.Odgovarajući na pitanje da li postoje dokazi za te tvrdnje, Saša Radulović je rekao da je "podneo mnogo krivičnih prijava o mnogo slučajeva korupcije a da je neke od tih krivičnih prijava podneo kao ministar"."Praktično sve su ignorisane od strane tužilaštva. Pre nego što sam postao ministar radio sam za kancelariju javnog tužioca sa svojim timom. Otkrili smo mnoge slične slučajeve koji potom nisu procesuirani. Došlo je do nekog dogovora, i sve je stavljeno pod tepih. Kada imate 30 godina takvog kontinuiteta, svaka nova vlast štiti prethodnu i nikad niko ni za šta ne odgovara. To je tužno, jer kada radite sa mladim policajcima koji su puni entuzijazma za posao i zaštitu javnog interesa, svedok ste njihovog razočaranja kada, nakon što sprovedu istragu i pribave dokaze, sve bude zaustavljeno", rekao je Radulović.Na pitanje da li bi medjunarodna pomoć bila od koristi, Radulović je odgovorio da "sve počinje u Srbiji odakle novac potiče, a potom je neophodno samo slediti trag novca, kroz koje zemlje je prošao i gde je završio"."To nije tako teško. Naravno, to je veliki posao. Medjutim, nije nuklearna fizika. Ono što moram da kažem je da EU sve ovo zna. Oni znaju tačno šta Vlada (Srbije) radi i to ne samo kada je reč o korupciji, isisavanju novca iz budžeta, zloupotrebama javnog novca, već i kada je reč o stanju demokratije, stanju u medijima, načinima kradje izbora, stanja biračkog spiska... U Srbiji imamo 6.8 miliona birača u biračkom spisku, a izdato je samo 5 miliona identifikacionih dokumenata. Razlika je 1.8 miliona ljudi", rekao je Radulović.Radulović je rekao da "EU sve to zna, pa opet bukvalno svaki EU zvaničnik koji dodje u Srbiju izgovara čuvenu rečenicu: "Srbija ide u dobrom pravcu" i dodao da je puna saradnja po pitanju migrantske krize razlog zbog koga (Aleksandar) Vučić uživa punu podršku"."Osnovno pitanje su migranti koji prolaze kroz Srbiju. Srbija je prva  zemlja koja im, po osnovu dogovora izmedju (Aleksandra) Vučića i Angele Merkel, daje papir koji potvrdjuje da su zatražili azil u Srbiji. Oni se prijavljuju za azil u Nemačkoj, ali Srbija je zemlja u kojoj izražavaju nameru da zatraže azil. S tim parčetom papira mogu ući u Nemačku, a ako Nemačka odluči da ih vrati, vratiće ih ili u zemlju porekla ili, ako to nije moguće, u zemlju koja se vodi kao zemlja prvog ulaska. Dakle, imamo migrante koji u Evropu ulaze preko Grčke, Bugarske, Makedonije, ali niko od njih im ne daje bilo kakav papir. Srbija je prva zemlja koja to čini", rekao je Radulović.Radulović je rekao i da "(predsednik Srbije Aleksandar) Vučić čak našim gradjanima kaže da imamo mnogo mladih, oko 50.000 godišnje, koji napuštaju Srbiju, jer je situacija vrlo loša, a onda kaže da će se broj migranata koji dolaze do 2030. godine izjednačiti s brojem ljudi koji iz zemlje odlaze, jer, postoji potreba za jeftinom radnom snagom za nemačke kompanije koje otvaraju svoje fabrike u Srbiji".Na pitanje da li, nakon ovakvih kritika, Srbija treba da nastavi da teži članstvu u EU Radulović je odgovorio da "smatra da je EU loš projekat koji će se loše završiti"."Nama jeste potrebna saradnja sa Evropom, ali to mora biti saradnja suverenih država. Mi sada imamo u EU na vlasti političare koje niko nije birao i koji ne odgovaraju gradjanima. Naša stranka se zove "Dosta je bilo". Mi smo pro-evropska, anti-EU stranka. EU nije Evropa, EU je projekat koji je otišao u pogrešnom pravcu. U korenu svega je finansijski sistem za koji verujem da upravlja projektom u kome Evropska centralna banka vodi politiku koja gura suverene države u dug bez ikakvog razloga. Evropi je potreban drugačiji projekat", izjavio je Radulović za Fajnenšel Tajms a navodi se u saopštenju pokreta Dosta je bilo.
text:
Radulovic for the Financial Times: There is a suspicion that Belgrade is leading a money laundering project

06 Nov 2019, 12:35

Movement President Enough (DJB) Sasa Radulovic told the Financial Times that "there is a reasonable doubt that the prosecutor would have to check if he were to do his job, that there was money laundering in the Belgrade project," a press release said today. Radulovic said that there was a suspicion that "the money was being drawn from Serbia through various embezzlement of public funds and funds, and then washed and returned to Serbia through United Arab Emirates investment funds. They just take their money laundering percentage. When the money goes back to Serbia, then the people through whom it came out of the country, and it is about people in power, use that money to buy property. "This is about the land on which Belgrade is being built. on water, but also on agricultural land in various places in Vojvodina, on companies and the like. I believe that this is the basis of all these so-called "investments in Serbia". The key is that all the companies that build Belgrade on the water, as well as all the decision-makers, are associated with top-level people. No Arabs. I do not know anyone who would make a huge investment and then would not be interested in it, but would let local people decide who gets how much money, "Radulovic told the Financial Times. Radulovic also said" we just made the plan for the development of that land, and then divided it into smaller parts, we could have earned more than one billion euros. So all that money went out of this deal, "the DJB said in an interview with the Financial Times. Asked if there was evidence for those allegations, Sasa Radulovic said that he had" filed many criminal complaints about many corruption cases. and that he had filed some of these criminal charges as a minister. "" Virtually all were ignored by the prosecution. Before becoming a minister I worked for the Attorney General's office with my team. We found many similar cases that were not subsequently prosecuted. There was an agreement, and everything was put under the rug. When you are 30 years of such continuity, every new government protects the previous one and never is responsible for anything. It is sad because when you work with young police officers who are enthusiastic about business and the protection of the public interest, you are witnessing their disappointment when everything is stopped after they investigate and obtain evidence, "Radulovic said. help was helpful, Radulovic replied that "it all starts in Serbia, where the money comes from, and then it is only necessary to follow the trail of money, which countries it went through and where it ended." Of course, it's a big deal. However, it is not nuclear physics. What I have to say is that the EU knows all this. They know exactly what the Government (Serbia) is doing, not only when it comes to corruption, squeezing money out of the budget, misusing public money, but also when it comes to the state of democracy, the state of the media, the ways of stealing elections, the state of the electoral roll. Serbia has 6.8 million voters in the electoral roll, and only 5 million identification documents have been issued. The difference is 1.8 million people, "Radulovic said. Radulovic said that" the EU knows all that, and again, literally every EU official who comes to Serbia utters the famous sentence: "Serbia is going in the right direction" and added that full cooperation is in place migrant crises the reason why (Aleksandar) Vucic enjoys full support. "" The main issue is migrants passing through Serbia. Serbia is the first country to give them, on the basis of an agreement between (Alexander) Vucic and Angela Merkel, that they have requested asylum in Serbia. They are applying for asylum in Germany, but Serbia is the country where they express their intention to seek asylum. With that piece of paper, they can enter Germany, and if Germany decides to return them, they will either return them to their country of origin or, if that is not possible, to a country which is kept as a country of first entry. So, we have migrants who enter Europe via Greece, Bulgaria, Macedonia, but none of them gives them any paper. Serbia is the first country to do that, "Radulovic said. Radulovic also said that" (Serbian President Aleksandar) Vucic even tells our citizens that we have many young people, about 50,000 a year, who leave Serbia because the situation is very bad, and then says that the number of migrants arriving by 2030 will be equal to the number of people leaving the country, because there is a need for cheap labor for German companies opening their factories in Serbia. "Asked whether, after such criticism, Serbia should continue to strive for EU membership Radulovic replied that "he thinks the EU is a bad project that will end badly." We now have politicians in the EU who are elected by no one and do not fit the citizens. Our party is called "That's Enough." We are a pro-European, anti-EU party. The EU is not Europe, the EU is a project that has gone in the wrong direction. At the root of it all is the financial system that I believe runs a project where the European Central Bank pursues a policy that pushes sovereign states into debt for no apparent reason. Europe needs a different project, "Radulovic told the Financial Times, according to a statement from the movement Enough.
